abstract: What can the contribution of professional didactics bring to the analysis of teaching practices? The following paper examines this question by making a few general reflections and opening two avenues of research: 1. the analysis of a teacher’s activity can be considered as the management of a dynamic environment; 2. yet, to go further in the analysis of the teacher-pupil interactions it can be worth being inspired by Winnicot, by identifying transitional concepts which would allow a better understanding of the dynamics of interactions.
